text_editor.name: Atom
text_editor.description: A hackable text editor for the 21st Century
text_editor.comment: Really appreciated by a lot of people, but I think that Visual Studio Code is just way better.

text_editor.name: Gedit
text_editor.description: Text editor of the GNOME desktop environment
text_editor.comment: Lightweight and fast to open, it's my editor for on-the-go edits.

text_editor.name: Visual Studio Code
text_editor.comment: Awesome compromise between a text editor and a heavy IDE. Improved by a huge number a plugins.

jetbrains_ide.name: Android Studio
jetbrains_ide.comment: Must-have for Android development. Awesome but heavy (like every JetBrain tool ever).

jetbrains_ide.name: Clion
jetbrains_ide.description: A cross-platform IDE for C and C++
jetbrains_ide.comment: The best IDE for C and C++. Awesome but heavy (like every JetBrain tool ever).

jetbrains_ide.name: IntelliJ IDEA Community
jetbrains_ide.comment: Java sucks less with it. Awesome but heavy (like every JetBrain tool ever), but even heavier since it's Java. Free version, but with less features.

jetbrains_ide.name: IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate
jetbrains_ide.description: Capable and Ergonomic Java IDE for Entreprise, Web and Mobile Development
jetbrains_ide.comment: Java sucks less with it. Awesome but heavy (like every JetBrain tool ever), but even heavier since it's Java.

jetbrains_ide.name: Pycharm Community
jetbrains_ide.comment: Awesome but heavy (like every JetBrain tool ever). Free version, but with less features.

jetbrains_ide.name: Pycharm Pro
jetbrains_ide.description: The Python IDE for Professional Developers
jetbrains_ide.comment: Awesome but heavy (like every JetBrain tool ever).

jetbrains_ide.name: RubyMine
jetbrains_ide.description: The Most Intelligent Ruby and Rails IDE

jetbrains_ide.name: WebStorm
jetbrains_ide.comment: Works fine, but VSCode is free, lighter and almost as good.

file_manager.name: Nautilus
file_manager.description: File explorer of the GNOME desktop environment
file_manager.comment: My favorite file explorer. Simple, intuitive, beautiful.

graphism.name: Gcolor3
graphism.description: Pick colors from the selector or the screen. A.K.A Color Picker.
graphism.comment: Useful for picking colors from everywhere.

graphism.name: GIMP
graphism.comment: Hard to learn. Hard to master. No compromise, just power.

graphism.name: Shotwell
graphism.comment: Nice to view images and crop them.

multimedia.name: VLC
multimedia.description: VLC media player, the open-source multimedia player
multimedia.comment: Must-have to be able to open everything.

productivity_and_office.name: FreeOffice
productivity_and_office.description: A complete, reliable, lightning-fast and Microsoft Office-compatible office suite with a word processor, spreadsheet, and presentation graphics software.

productivity_and_office.name: LibreOffice
productivity_and_office.comment: Microsoft Office is better, but not on Linux.

productivity_and_office.name: Toggl Track
productivity_and_office.description: Simple and Intuitive Time Tracking Software
productivity_and_office.comment: My favorite time tracking tool. Free, simple and synchronized on web. Available later.

productivity_and_office.name: SimpleNote
productivity_and_office.description: The simplest way to keep notes.
productivity_and_office.comment: My favorite notepad. Free, simple and synchronized on web.

social.name: Discord
social.description: All-in-one voice and text chat for gamers that's free, secure, and works on both your desktop and phone.

system_tool.name: Filelight
system_tool.description: Filelight creates an interactive map to show the disk utilisation of your computer
system_tool.comment: Useful to visualise what takes you space on your disk.

system_tool.name: Gnome System Monitor
system_tool.comment: Useful to visualise what uses your RAM, CPU, GPU and network.

system_tool.name: Timeshift
system_tool.description: A system restore utility for Linux

terminal_emulator.name: Gnome Terminal
terminal_emulator.comment: I used it for a long time, but Konsole have a better support of zsh.

terminal_emulator.name: Konsole
terminal_emulator.comment: My favorite Terminal Emulator. Fully support everything I need.

web_browser.name: Chromium
web_browser.description: Chromium web browser, open-source version of Chrome
web_browser.comment: I never used it, I like the Mozilla philosophy.

web_browser.name: Tor Browser Launcher
web_browser.description: A program to help you download, keep updated, and run the Tor Browser Bundle
web_browser.comment: Must-have if you care about yourself.

other.name: Simple Screen Recorder
other.description: A feature-rich screen recorder that supports X11 and OpenGL
other.comment: Easy to use and works fine.

other.name: ZSH
other.description: A very advanced and programmable command interpreter (shell) for UNIX
other.comment: Beautiful, useful, with a lot of nice plugins. Is on every UNIX rice.
